intro: Acrotriche divaricata, commonly known as the variable acrotriche, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
